lead_paragraph: PLATT--Graham Lusk, of Laurel Hollow, NY and Siletz, OR died peacefully on January 25th, 2016. Graham attended Brooks School and graduated from University of Virginia with a BA in History. He served as first lieutenant during the Korean War (1951-1952). He worked as an insurance broker for Marsh and McLennan Co., Rollins, Burdick and Hunter Co. and Bradley and Parker Inc. until his retirement in 2005. Graham Platt married Ann Lethbridge in Cold Spring Harbor, NY where they resided for 52 years. They moved in 2005 to Oregon and celebrated 63rd years together prior to Ann's death. Graham served as vestry and sang in the church choir at St. John's Episcopal Church for many years. He especially enjoyed sailing and tennis as a member of the Cold Spring Harbor Beach Club. Graham was also a longtime member/secretary of "Club 20" formed in 1958 in Syosset, NY. Graham is preceded in death by parents Collier and Louise Platt, wife Ann Lethbridge Platt and brother, Henry B. Platt. Graham is survived by his children Christina May Nelson, Graham Leghe Platt and Gordon Lethbridge Platt of Siletz, OR, Huntington, NY, and Charleston, SC, by his brother Thomas C. Platt of Bradford, CT, seven grandchildren and seven great- grandchildren. The family requests that memorial donations be made to St. John's Episcopal Church, PO Box 266, Cold Spring Harbor, NY 11724. 1/3
